greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows given by [2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,...] DELTA [1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938 .
comment: Inverse of Riordan array (1/(1+2x),x/(1+3x+2x^2)) (a signed version of A124237). _Paul Barry_, Apr 28 2009:

Peart and Woodson give a factorization of this array in the Riordan group as (1/(1 - 3*x), x/(1 - 3*x)) * (C(2*x^2), x*C(2*x^2)) * (1/(1 + x), x), where C(x) = 1 + x + 2*x^2 + 5*x^3 + 14*x^4 + ... is the o.g.f. of the Catalan numbers A000108. - _Peter Bala_, Aug 07 2014
link: Paul Barry, Laurent Biorthogonal Polynomials and Riordan Arrays, arXiv preprint arXiv:1311.2292 [math.CA], 2013.
P. Peart and L. Woodson, Triple factorization of some Riordan matrices, The Fib. Quart., Vol. 31 No. 2, May 1993.
Sheng-Liang Yang, Yan-Ni Dong, and Tian-Xiao He, Some matrix identities on colored Motzkin paths, Discrete Mathematics 340.12 (2017): 3081-3091. See p. 3087.
formula: Sum_{k, k>=0} T(m,k)*T(n,k)*2^k = T(m+n,0) = A006318(m+n). - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 24 2010
T(n,k) = S(n,n-k) - 2*S(n, n-k-2), where S(n,k) = Sum_{j = 0..k} binomial(n-1,k-j)*binomial(n,j)*2^j. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 20 2018
mathematica: T[n_, 0] := Hypergeometric2F1[-n, n + 1, 2, -1]; T[n_, k_] := Binomial[-1 + n, -k + n] Hypergeometric2F1[k - n, -n, k, 2] - 2 Binomial[-1 + n, -2 - k + n] Hypergeometric2F1[2 + k - n, -n, 2 + k, 2]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 8}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Peter Luschny_, Feb 20 2018 *)
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 27 2007
